oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter about rumors of a new Vietnamese campaign
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three page letter from Thunder IV (Highway 13 was nicknamed "Thunder Road" by US troops). "Our base camp (Lai Khe) has been hit daily by mortars and RPG [rocket-propelled grenade] rounds. Even in daylight Charlie hits Lai Khe." Letter includes comments about Gen. Westmoreland on radio, Americans wounded at Lai Khe, NDPs (night defensive positions), and money.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; Vietnam War, 1961-1975 -- Personal narratives, American; Correspondence
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher D. Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia in 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970.
